etymologies: mid 19th century: modern Latin, from Greek ōion ‘egg’ + the diminutive suffix -idion

definitions: a type of fungal spore (conidium) formed by the breaking up of fungal hyphae into cells, especially as produced by powdery mildews.
shortDefinitions: type of fungal spore conidium formed by breaking up of fungal hyphae into cells

definitions: a fungal disease affecting vines, caused by a powdery mildew.

notes.text: The fungus is Uncinula necator (formerly Oidium tuckeri), family Erysiphaceae, subdivision Ascomycotina

shortDefinitions: fungal disease affecting vines, caused by powdery mildew
